alert.note: Alert for Eagle; Garfield; Pitkin (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 28 at 3:30PM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR AN ICE JAM IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam is possible. * WHERE...The Roaring Fork River in portions of northwest Colorado and west central Colorado, including the following counties, in northwest Colorado, Eagle and Garfield. In west central Colorado, Pitkin. * WHEN...Until 500 PM MST Monday. * IMPACTS...Anglers and anyone near or in the Roaring Fork River should use extreme caution and be on the lookout for ice and debris flowing in the river. Move away from the river and seek higher ground if an ice jam occurs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 323 PM MST, observers noticed ice build up along the river near the advised area. Minor flooding is possible if an ice jam is released.
info.instruction: Emergency management and law enforcement are asking all citizens to use extreme caution in and around the Roaring Fork River.
